articles.description: The test kits have been found to be less accurate at diagnosing COVID-19 than claimed, after the federal government bought 500,000 of them.
articles.content:
In March the government announced it had bought the tests and would roll them out to GPs and hospitals within days. They never arrived at clinics.
As late as last Thursday Health Minister Greg Hunt said they were still undergoing analysis.
He told media the… [+2961 chars]

articles.author: Science X staff
articles.title: Queenslanders needed to help find potential COVID-19 immunotherapy treatment - Medical Xpress
articles.description: QIMR Berghofer scientists are urging Queenslanders who have recovered from COVID-19 to help them discover how the human immune system fights the disease—and hopefully develop immunotherapies to treat very sick patients.
articles.content:
QIMR Berghofer scientists are urging Queenslanders who have recovered from COVID-19 to help them discover how the human immune system fights the diseaseand hopefully develop immunotherapies to treat very sick patients.

articles.author: James Kingsland
articles.title: COVID-19: First bowel imaging study implicates blood clots - Medical News Today
articles.description: A recent analysis of abdominal scans suggests that blood clots in small arteries might starve bowel tissue of oxygen in people with severe COVID-19.
articles.content:
People with COVID-19 often experience gastrointestinal symptoms. An analysis of abdominal scans suggests that blood clots in small arteries may starve bowel tissue of oxygen in the most severely ill patients.
In the early stages of the COVID-19 outbreak in C… [+4424 chars]
